speaker: Episodic Comedy (TV)
text: Rob Greenberg  * * *  ## Cast List [_in order of appearance_]     JOANNE.....................................................LISA COLES  FRASIER CRANE..........................................KELSEY GRAMMER  STEWARDESS...............................................LESLIE ISHII  FELICITY......................................................KIM OJA  KELLY EASTERBROOK...........................................SELA WARD  ROZ DOYLE.................................................PERI GILPIN  BOB "BULLDOG" BRISCOE......................................DAN BUTLER  DAPHNE MOON...............................................JANE LEEVES  MARTIN CRANE.............................................JOHN MAHONEY  NILES CRANE.........................................DAVID HYDE PIERCE  WAITER.................................................ANDREW PHILPOT   * * *  ## Transcript {nick hartley}     [_Act One_]  **STRANGERS ON A PLANE**  [_Scene One - Interior Of A Plane. Frasier is sat with the woman from "Odd Man Out", Joanne_]

speaker: Joanne
text: Well, I should warn you.  If we hit turbulence, I may hold on to you for dear life.

speaker: Frasier
text: I should warn you, I'm hoping for a bumpy ride!

speaker: Joanne
text: Why are you going to Acapulco?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, it's rather an amusing story.  You see, I came down to the airport on sort of a blind date with a cello player. Of course, she didn't know it was a blind date, actually, it was all in my head. [_laughs_] But, er, so I bumped into you and you said you were going to Acapulco, I thought I might tag along.

speaker: Joanne
text: So, the only reason you're on this plane is because of me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Call it Kismet.

speaker: Joanne
text: [_to one of the cabin crew_] Can I switch seats?

speaker: Crew
text: You're lucky, normally this flight is jammed.  [_She goes to the back of the plane_]

speaker: Frasier
text: See, Kismet!  [_A woman sitting behind him, Felicity, peeks her head over and talks to Frasier_]

speaker: Felicity
text: I didn't mean to eavesdrop, but I have to say, I'd be flattered if someone got on a plane to be with me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Felicity
text: Yeah, I mean what can be more romantic than that?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, it's a little awkward trying to talk like this. Is that seat taken?

speaker: Felicity
text: No, come sit here, please.  [_Frasier moves into the seat next to the woman_]

speaker: Frasier
text: At last.  I'm Frasier Crane.

speaker: Felicity
text: Felicity Stafford.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a pleasure.

speaker: Felicity
text: And this is my husband, David.  [_Frasier looks over at the man in the seat next to him ominously. David looks displeased to say the least_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, darn! I forgot to order my kosher meal.  So sorry.  It was lovely meeting you both.  [_Frasier gets up and moves toward the front of the plane where a member of the cabin crew directs him to another seat on an empty row. He takes the window seat, thanking the stewardess.  He picks up a copy of the in-flight magazine as another woman, Kelly, is directed to a seat on his row_]

speaker: Kelly
text: Oh, thank God the flight's late, I was sure I'd missed it. [_sits, to stewardess:_] Thank you.  [_Frasier and Kelly nod at each other.  Frasier keeps looking over at her and seems to be comparing her to somebody in the magazine_]

speaker: Kelly
text: [_realises_] Yes, it's me.  Amazing what they can do with make- up and lighting.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it is amazing. [_realises what he has said_] Not that they didn't have plenty to work with. [_digging himself into a hole_] Oh, by plenty, I don't mean anything referring to... well... [_holds his breast_] ...here, you just stay right here, I'll change seats.

speaker: Kelly
text: No, no, wait.  Your voice sounds really familiar.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm Dr. Frasier Crane from the radio. [_shakes hand_]

speaker: Kelly
text: [_shakes hand_] Kelly Easterbrook, from the magazine. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Well, I'm assuming that you're off to a photo shoot on the beaches of Mexico.

speaker: Kelly
text: No, actually, I only model part-time these days.  I'm in a PhD department with the University of Washington.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's your field?

speaker: Kelly
text: Zoology.  That's why I'm going to Mexico, to observe the spiny cald iguana.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_amazed_] A model and a scholar.  This is the part where I normally wake up.  [_We then cut to Frasier waking up as if it was all a dream.  However the camera pulls back to show him in bed in Acapulco with Kelly Easterbrook in his arms.  He kisses her forehead and goes back to sleep with pride_]  [_Scene Two - Acapulco Hotel Room. Kelly and Frasier are waking up in each other's arms_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I know what you're thinking.

speaker: Kelly
text: Hmmm?

speaker: Frasier
text: Last night, walking along the beach when we kicked off our shoes and looked up at the amazing blanket of stars...

speaker: Kelly
text: Actually, I was remembering when that iguana ran across my foot and you jumped into my arms.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that too.  You're really quite strong.

speaker: Kelly
text: I am a supermodel!  So, Frasier, any chance you'd be interested in seeing more of me?

speaker: Frasier
text: There's more?! [_beat_] Of course, of course, I was hoping we would.

speaker: Kelly
text: Well, that's great.  Actually, there's one thing I should mention.  It's a little awkward.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is?

speaker: Kelly
text: Well, I'm in the process of breaking up with someone; he plays for the Seahawks and we're always in the public eye, these things have a way of getting out.  I'd appreciate it if just for now you didn't tell anyone about you and me.

speaker: Frasier
text: What happened between us will never leave this room.  [_They kiss passionately_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as the kiss breaks_] And if there's a God in heaven, neither will we!  [_They kiss again_]  [_Scene Three - Radio Station. Bulldog is getting some food out of the machine as Roz comes to him_]

speaker: Roz
text: Have you seen Frasier?

speaker: Bulldog
text: What, he's not back from the airport yet?

speaker: Roz
text: No.  That's a lot of cheese and crackers, you're going to eat all those?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Don't be stupid, I'm having people over tonight.  [_Frasier appears looking decidedly refreshed_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning, all.

speaker: Roz
text: There you are, I almost gave up on you.  [_They enter the booth_]

speaker: Roz
text: So, Mr. Impulsive, I got your message.  How was Mexico?

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, relaxing.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, well, considering what a bump your sex life has been lately, I know you were looking for a little of, well, you know, action.  You know, south of the border.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, just because the last time you went to Mexico you were hit on more than a pi�ata, that doesn't mean that was the purpose of my visit as well.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah, right, you wanted to hear that Acapulco Philharmonic!  [_Bulldog enters_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: So, doc', did you get any?

speaker: Frasier
text: That is none of your business!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ah, well, better luck next time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did it ever occur to you that I'm merely being discreet? That I actually did meet a woman, I just don't care to broadcast it?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Sure, that'll happen!  [_Bulldog and Roz share a laugh_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Please!  You know, frankly, I don't have time for this nonsense.  What I did or did not do on my vacation is none of your concern.  Don't you have better things to do than just speculate about my sex life?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, "Frasier Crane's sex life."  Hey, there's a word for that... it's an Oxy... Oxy... [_thinks_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_completing_] ...moron!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, wow, easy, I'll get it.  [_Roz pushes Bulldog out of the booth_]  [_Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne is helping Martin with his exercises as Eddie watches_]

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, now, flip over, ten kicks on each side.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Jeez, I hate this one.  What does it do anyway?

speaker: Daphne
text: Nothing for you, but it does get a nice breeze going.  [_The doorbell sounds and Daphne answers it to Niles_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne.  [_Niles looks on at Martin's strange position_]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Eddie.  Good boy, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_gets up_] That's it, I'm through.

speaker: Niles
text: So, where's Frasier?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he got in a while ago but jumped right in the shower.

speaker: Niles
text: So we still have no idea why he went to Mexico?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you heard the same message we did.  He wanted to do something spur of the moment, so he jumped on a plane.

speaker: Niles
text: That doesn't concern you?  That's not exactly like him, to board a plane without reservations and luggage... slumber mask.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he probably just went down there to try to meet some women.

speaker: Niles
text: I've seen this with my patients.  They get so distressed over a series of failures, especially romantic ones, that they act out in bizarre ways.  [_Frasier then enters from his shower wearing a bathrobe, a towel around his head and nursing a cognac_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, is there anything more refreshing after a long flight than a hot soak in eucalyptus sauce and a snifter of warmed "Poir William"!  [_Frasier exits to the kitchen_]

speaker: Niles
text: Nothing yet, but keep your ears open.  [_Frasier enters again_]

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, Dr. Crane, we're all awfully eager to hear about your trip.  Did you have a nice time?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, lovely.

speaker: Martin
text: Did you meet any girls?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, well, you know me, dad, I'm not one to kiss and tell.

speaker: Martin
text: Struck out, huh?  Well, it'll all turn around for ya'.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why does everyone assume that it's impossible for me to meet a woman?

speaker: Martin
text: No need to get mad, I'm on your side, I just feel bad for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_compassionately_] We all do.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, frankly, I'm sick and tired of everyone's pity. The fact is I did meet a woman down there, a perfectly fabulous woman, we had an utterly romantic weekend.

speaker: Martin
text: Why didn't you just tell us that from the start?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not at liberty to discuss it.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, that pesky Club Med oath of silence!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  She asked me to be discreet.  You see, she's a rather famous supermodel and right now she's going through a break- up with a star football player on the Seahawks.  Didn't want any publicity, so you see, before I identify her to you, I have to ask you not to ever to repeat this to anyone.

speaker: Niles
text: I'd urge you to do the same.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angry_] Her name is Kelly Easterbrook!

speaker: Daphne
text: Ah, the lotion girl!  She has such milky skin.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought so, yes.  We were inseparable the entire weekend.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, some people think I look like her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  [_Frasier makes doubting faces at Niles_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I've got a picture of her, I'll be right back. [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it's one thing to concoct a little white lie, but to come up with a supermodel?!

speaker: Martin
text: Who dumped an NFL player for Frasier! [_laughs_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I think you two are just being awful, I've never known Dr. Crane to tell a lie.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, this is not without precedent.  When he was ten, he forged letters from Leonard Bernstein and told everyone they were pen pals.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah.

speaker: Niles
text: He'd come bounding up the stairs, "Got another one from Lenny"!  We were all agog until Mr. Bernstein wrote that his Broadway debut was "Candide" when everyone knows that it was "On The Town."  That's when we knew it was a fake!

speaker: Martin
text: The sloppy kid lettering was also a clue!  [_Frasier enters with a magazine cutting_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Here she is. [_hands it over_]

speaker: Martin
text: Is this from a magazine?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, yeah, she's in lots of magazines and billboards too. And now she's my girlfriend.  [_Takes picture back_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm off to bed.  I didn't get much sleep over the weekend, you know what I mean!  [_Frasier exits to everyone's pretend cheers_]

speaker: Daphne
text: He just snapped like a twig, didn't he!  **SHADOW OF A DOUBT**  [_Scene Five - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier is sat at a table on his own when his mobile rings.  He answers it_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] Hello. Kelly.  Hi, gee, I didn't know you were back in town.  Er, I'd love to.  Right, well, I'll see you there, in what, half an hour?  Okay.  Well, yeah, me too. Bye.  [_Frasier hangs up as Niles, Daphne and Martin enter_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, glad we caught you.  We're off to the Buster Keaton retrospective, care to join us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I'm dashing off to "L'Escalias" for a late lunch with Kelly.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, your supermodel.

speaker: Martin
text: You didn't mention anything about that when you left this morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: She just called, she came up early from a modeling assignment in Hawaii, I suspect to see you-know-who. [_laughs_]  [_Frasier uses his phone_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to phone_] Yes, Dr. Crane.  Listen, I need my usual table in about twenty minutes.  Oh yes, and chill your finest bottle of Pouilly Fuisse. [_hangs up_] Well, modeling those swimsuits, she works up quite a thirst!  [_Frasier laughs as he exits_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Poor sod.

speaker: Niles
text: Doesn't he realise how outlandish it all sounds?

speaker: Martin
text: Even a fake supermodel would have dumped him by now!

speaker: Daphne
text: I wish there was something we could do.

speaker: Niles
text: There is.  When he was in the phase of his Leonard Bernstein obsession, we finally confronted him, and, as you may recall, Dad, he was relieved that once and for all he could give up the charade.

speaker: Martin
text: [_corrects pronounciation_] Char-ade.

speaker: Niles
text: [_adamant_] Cha-rade.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess we could talk to him.  But what are we going to say?

speaker: Niles
text: It won't be easy.  So, tell him that we know what's going on and that he doesn't have to pretend anymore.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, but situations like that make me uncomfortable.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, there's always the outside chance that we'll walk into that restaurant and some gorgeous supermodel will be draped all over Frasier...  [_They burst into laughter_]

speaker: Daphne
text: We needed that.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I thought we could do with a little tension breaker!  [_End of Act One_]  [_Act Two_]  **THE LADY VANISHES**  [_Scene One - Restaurant. Frasier is sat at the table as Kelly enters to greet him.  The table is set out with appetisers including caviar_]

speaker: Kelly
text: Frasier.  [_They greet each other and kiss_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You look wonderful.

speaker: Kelly
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, here, sit.  I ordered some appertisers.

speaker: Kelly
text: Oh, this is so sweet, but I can't stay.  My lab called and there's been a small emergency.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is everything alright?

speaker: Kelly
text: Our incubator broke and my iguana eggs need to be moved to another lab right away.  I hope you understand.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course I'm disappointed, but we'll do it again sometime.

speaker: Kelly
text: I'll call you as soon as I'm done at the lab.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great, okay.  [_Kelly goes up the stairs as the waiter enters_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calls_] I'll keep my fingers crossed, here's hoping your eggs are still fertile.  [_Kelly exits_]

speaker: Waiter
text: My wife had trouble conceiving too.  It turned out to be me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, mystery solved, off you go.  [_The waiter exits as Frasier eats his hors d'oeuvres.  Daphne, Martin and Niles enter and watch down on him from the balcony.  As there are two places set, it seems Frasier is entertaining an invisible woman_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that is so sad.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll say, nobody's ever bought me caviar and I'm real! [_off Martin and Niles' glance_] Maybe this is a family thing.  [_Daphne exits as Niles and Martin approaches Frasier, they pull up chairs and greet each other_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Is something the matter?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, we were just in the neighbourhood.  Thought we'd stop by, see if you've changed your mind about the movie.  [_Martin takes a bit of caviar up to his mouth, but on smelling it, throws it back down disgusted_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You seem to be awfully persistent, but you know, I just may join you.  My date cancelled at the last moment.

speaker: Niles
text: Listen, Frasier.  Whatever it is that makes you feel the need to perpetuate this fantasy woman, you don't have to on our account.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fantasy?!

speaker: Martin
text: We're your family.  We don't care if you haven't been out with anyone in quite a while.

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, you actually believe that I invented this relationship!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Frasier, it's no crime to go down to Acapulco and come back empty-handed.

speaker: Frasier
text: I did not come back empty-handed, I came back with two huge handfuls!  Kelly was just here.  She was called away on an emergency.

speaker: Niles
text: That would be a modeling emergency?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  She only models to raise money for her real interest: zoology. She's a PhD candidate and she raises iguanas. [_they obviously don't buy this_] The incubator broke and her eggs were in danger, and it was vital that only she transfer them over... Oh, the details are not important.  The fact is that I'm having a relationship with this woman!  [_There is a pause whilst Martin and Niles try to take in this information_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_puts a hand on Frasier's arm_] We love you Frasier.  Niles, me, Daphne...

speaker: Niles
text: Leonard Bernstein.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angry_] I knew one day you would throw that back in my face!  [_Frasier stands and leaves the restaurant_]  [_Scene Two -  Frasier's Apartment. Kelly is leaving a note on Frasier's door as the elevator doors open. Frasier steps off_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kelly.

speaker: Kelly
text: Oh, hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi.

speaker: Kelly
text: I was just leaving you a note.  I'm really sorry about lunch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's all right.  Do you have time to come in?

speaker: Kelly
text: Sure.  Good news is that I was able to move all of my eggs over to another lab.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_unlocks door_] Well, I hope you didn't put them all in one basket. [_laughs_]

speaker: Kelly
text: Why does everyone think that's funny?  [_The two enter the apartment, she is taken aback_]

speaker: Kelly
text: What a beautiful apartment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Can I interest you in a glass of Beaujoulais Nouveau?

speaker: Kelly
text: I'd love some.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  [_Frasier goes to the wine shelf_]

speaker: Kelly
text: I actually have something to toast.  My doctorate advisor's asked me to join his... [_pauses as she notices Martin's chair_] ...team of researchers going to the Galapagos Islands.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pouring wine_] Well, that does deserve a toast.

speaker: Kelly
text: I'm replacing someone, so it's all very last minute.  We leave in the morning.  I'll be there for two months, inseminating indigenous iguanas.  I've called all my friends, they couldn't believe it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nor will mine!  [_They clink glasses and sip_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_saddened_] Two months?

speaker: Kelly
text: Hey, I feel terrible leaving town so early in our relationship, but it's the opportunity of a life-time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll be here when you return.  We'll always have one incredible night to look back on fondly.

speaker: Kelly
text: I think we'll be looking back on two incredible nights.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm sorry darling, it's just one night; Saturday night, then of course Sunday, you were...  [_Kelly puts hers and his glasses down and gives him a raunchy look_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realises_] Oh.  Right, right.  [_They kiss passionately_]  **PSYCHO**  [_Scene Three - Frasier's Bedroom. That evening, Kelly and Frasier are asleep in each other's arms. Frasier awakes and snuggles close to her.  She seems dead to the world.  An expression of realisation then appears over Frasier's face as he looks down at the elusive Kelly.  He slowly moves to the edge of the bed and slides off.  Frasier then tip-toes to his cabinet and slowly opens it, taking out a camera. He is thrilled as he slowly sits back down on the bed.  Then in one go, he snuggles back up to Kelly as she sleeps like a log.  He then gets himself into a pose with the camera so that Daphne, Martin and Niles would not have one doubt that Kelly was his girlfriend.  He pulls back the covers a little bit, showing the camera her nightie and tries to take a picture.  However, the camera seems to be faulty as he presses it several times with no success.  Frasier then takes the camera in and begins to fiddle about with it.  Suddenly it flashes.  Kelly sits up all of a sudden as Frasier hides the camera behind his pillow_]

speaker: Kelly
text: What was that?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing, nothing.

speaker: Kelly
text: I must have drifted off there.  [_The camera begins rewinding_]

speaker: Kelly
text: What's that noise?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't hear anything?  [_Kelly searches and finds the camera_]

speaker: Kelly
text: You took a picture of me while I was asleep?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely not!  This is... it's your going away present.  Bon Voyage.  [_Frasier offers it to her but she refuses_]

speaker: Kelly
text: You're disgusting!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, Kelly, Kelly, listen, please, you don't understand.  [_Kelly starts throwing the pillows at him in anger_]

speaker: Kelly
text: I don't believe this!  Get out! [_Frasier protests_] Get out!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stops protesting_] All right. [_moves to door_] You know, you think being a professional model, you might be a little more relaxed about somebody taking your...

speaker: Kelly
text: [_screams_] Get out!  [_Frasier leaves his bedroom, putting on his dressing gown_]  [_Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is still in his dressing gown as Kelly enters in her clothes_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kelly, don't you think we should talk about this.  I won't see you again for two months!

speaker: Kelly
text: You won't see me again for a lot longer than that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kelly!  [_Frasier follows Kelly out into the hallway where she calls for the lift_]

speaker: Kelly
text: What?  It wasn't enough just to tell people you bagged a model.  You had to take a picture!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Kelly
text: What were you planning to do with it, sell it to the tabloids?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Kelly
text: Pass it around the office, show it to all your friends?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, just my immediate family!

speaker: Kelly
text: [_impatient_] I'm taking the stairs.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kelly!  [_Kelly goes to the stairwell as Frasier runs off after her_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s_] Kelly! [_depressed_] Kelly.  [_Frasier enters back into the hallways as the elevator doors open. Daphne, Martin and Niles go to him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you missed her again.  She's running down the stairs, you can catch her if you still want to.

speaker: Martin
text: [_patronising_] We believe you, Frasier, now let's just get your robe all cinched up. [_ties it up_] And get you back inside.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't patronise me!  [_They enter the apartment_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, look, look, TWO wine glasses!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes, one for you, one for her, that proves it all right!  [_Daphne gives the others a panicked look which Frasier notices_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_psychotic_] I AM NOT CRAZY! [_sits on the sofa in a rage_] I am dating a supermodel zoologist, who I stole away from a professional football player, and she is off to the Galapagos islands to artificially inseminate iguanas! [_breaking down_] Is that so hard to believe?!  [_Frasier collapses on the sofa as Kelly enters.  Frasier jumps up_]

speaker: Kelly
text: Frasier, I want to... [_notices crowd_] Oh!  Well, good crowd! Where were you all hiding, under the bed?! [_begins to rip out film from Frasier's camera_] You know, it makes me sick to think I'd even spent one night with you, let alone two!  I have known a lot of reptiles and looked under a lot of rocks in my life, but I have never seen anything slither out quite as slimy and repulsive as you!  [_Kelly exits in anger.  The rest just look at Frasier, startled. Frasier takes back his calm and begins dusting down the pillows on the sofa.  After a pause for tension, he looks at the three in a sophisticated, macho, "I was right, you were wrong" kind of way_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what do you think of me now?  [_Frasier exits the scene having restored all dignity.  But the other three, if possible, look even more worried._]  [_End of Act Two_]
